intro: Knoxia laevis, commonly known as the smooth knoxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, thick rhizome. Knoxia laevis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its unique floral display.
